8vo.gloss: the size of a book whose pages are made by folding a sheet of paper three times to form eight leaves

vocabulary.gloss: a language user's knowledge of words

vocal.gloss: given to expressing yourself freely or insistently

vocal music.gloss: music intended to be performed by one or more singers, usually with instrumental accompaniment

vocal organ.gloss: any of the organs involved in speech production

vocalisation.gloss: the sound made by the vibration of vocal folds modified by the resonance of the vocal tract

vocalizing.gloss: the act of singing vocal music

vocation.gloss: the particular occupation for which you are trained

voice of conscience.gloss: an inner voice that judges your behavior

voiced sound.gloss: a speech sound accompanied by sound from the vocal cords

voiceless consonant.gloss: a consonant produced without sound from the vocal cords

voicemail.gloss: a computerized system for answering and routing telephone calls

void.gloss: lacking any legal or binding force

voidance.gloss: the act of removing the contents of something

volaille.gloss: the flesh of a chicken used for food

volary.gloss: a building where birds are kept

volatility.gloss: the trait of being unpredictably irresolute

volcanic eruption.gloss: the sudden occurrence of a violent discharge of steam and volcanic material

volcano.gloss: a fissure in the earth's crust (or in the surface of some other planet) through which molten lava and gases erupt

volcanology.gloss: the branch of geology that studies volcanoes

vole.gloss: any of various small mouselike rodents of the family Cricetidae (especially of genus Microtus) having a stout short-tailed body and inconspicuous ears and inhabiting fields or meadows

volition.gloss: the capability of conscious choice and decision and intention

volleyball game.gloss: a game in which two teams hit an inflated ball over a high net using their hands

volt.gloss: a unit of potential equal to the potential difference between two points on a conductor carrying a current of 1 ampere when the power dissipated between the two points is 1 watt

volt-ampere.gloss: a unit of electrical power in an AC circuit equal to the power dissipated when 1 volt produces a current of 1 ampere

volta.gloss: Italian physicist after whom the volt is named

synonyms.word: conte alessandro giuseppe antonio anastasio volta

voltage.gloss: the rate at which energy is drawn from a source that produces a flow of electricity in a circuit

voltage divider.gloss: resistors connected in series across a voltage source

voltaic.gloss: pertaining to or producing electric current by chemical action

voltaic battery.gloss: battery consisting of a number of voltaic cells arranged in series or parallel

voltaic cell.gloss: an electric cell that generates an electromotive force by an irreversible conversion of chemical to electrical energy

voltaic pile.gloss: battery consisting of voltaic cells arranged in series

voltaire.gloss: French writer who was the embodiment of 18th century Enlightenment (1694-1778)

voltaren.gloss: a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (trade name Voltaren) that is administered only orally

volte-face.gloss: a major change in attitude or principle or point of view

volubility.gloss: the quality of being facile in speech and writing
